solution_line_template: Mr. Valentino has twice as many ducks as chicken on his farm, which means there are {multiplier_ducks_chickens}*{num_chickens} = <<{multiplier_ducks_chickens}*{num_chickens}={num_ducks}>>{num_ducks} ducks on the farm.

The number of turkeys is three times as many as the number of ducks on Mr. Valentino's farm, a total of {multiplier_turkeys_ducks}*{num_ducks} = <<{multiplier_turkeys_ducks}*{num_ducks}={num_turkeys}>>{num_turkeys} turkeys.
In total, Mr. Valentino has {num_turkeys}+{num_ducks} = <<{num_turkeys}+{num_ducks}={total_ducks_turkeys}>>{total_ducks_turkeys} ducks and turkeys on his farm.

If you add the number of chickens on the farm, the number of birds on the farm becomes {total_ducks_turkeys}+{num_chickens} = <<{total_ducks_turkeys}+{num_chickens}={total_birds}>>{total_birds} birds.
